reviewTimeLines.summary: FAB-1717 - Change in the build.gradle to solve an error in the TestEnvironment

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: Is there a need to capture all the details before closing ?

comments.author: Vinod Geeachan
comments.comment: Hi Tom, in this test, we are simulating the same scenario akin to finishing the Intake. The only difference is, we are clicking 'Close intake' button on the wrap up page instead of the 'Next' button and making sure that 'Snapshot' document is not displayed. Everything else has been done (similarly to finishing intake), except for clicking the 'Close intake' button.

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: You are able to click 'Close' at any point in the intake and get the same result, therefore there is no need to add all the details and then close. Just close at the first page.

comments.author: Vinod Geeachan
comments.comment: Hi Tom, I think it should stay.

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment:
You might update the Scenario and GWT to reflect this.
They currently mention 'midway' ( "Closing an Absence Intake Process midway without finishing the intake" )
Also remember this is all existing functionality and probably doesn't need a huge amount of selenium written for it

comments.author: Vinod Geeachan
comments.comment: Hi Tom, during Absence intake, clicking the 'Close' button at any point is similar to leaving the intake midway/in the middle (leaving without finishing the intake). In such a scenario, user can come back and edit the intake details. But, if the user clicks 'Next button' on the wrap up screen, intake is finished (user cannot go back and change any details).

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment:
Hi Vinod, your comment above "Hi Tom, during Absence intake, clicking the 'Close' button at any point is similar to leaving the intake midway/in the middle (leaving without finishing the intake)" is just the point I'm making i.e. you don't have to go to the ned of intake to 'close'. Therefore there is no advantage to inputting ALL intake details to simply click close on the last page. Inputting all details is covered in a previous test.
You simply want to check here that a snapshot is not created when you exit an intake before the wrap up screen

comments.author: Vinod Geeachan
comments.comment: I have updated the test to suit your opinion

comments.author: Tom Gurrie
comments.comment: This method name should reflect the step name. Are the others ok ?

comments.author: Vinod Geeachan
comments.comment: Thanks Tom, I have updated the method names to reflect the step names
